list.name: Changes
list.comment:
fix: Corrected Android 15 version information
This commit addresses an issue with the displayed Android 15 version information:
- The Android 15 codename was initially shown as "Vanilla Ice Cream," which has been corrected to "VanillaIceCream" (without the space) to align with official naming. - The version code has been incremented to reflect this update.

task.summary: Default task
Update 2.0_r1
Update 2.1_r1
Update 3.0_r1
Update 3.1_r1
Update 4.0_r1
Refractored all app source code
Refractored all app source code
Updated funding
Added the new nav drawer

chore: Updated .gitignore
Updated the .gitignore file to exclude additional files and directories from version cont

refactor: App architecture rework, UI improvements, and dependency updates (Work in Progress)
Significantly refactored the app architecture by introducing Repos and ViewModels. Improved code stability by addressing the Help screen entry crash. Redesigned the app home and main screens for a better user experience. Added edge-to-edge compatibility to select screens. Updated all dependencies to the latest versions.
**Note:** This is a work-in-progress commit. Further development and refinements are expected in subsequent commits.

refactor: App architecture rework, UI improvements, and dependency updates (Work in Progress)
Significantly refactored the app architecture by introducing Repos and ViewModels. Improved code stability by addressing the Help screen entry crash. Redesigned the app home and main screens for a better user experience. Added edge-to-edge compatibility to select screens. Updated all dependencies to the latest versions.
**Note:** This is a work-in-progress commit. Further development and refinements are expected in subsequent commits.

refactor: App architecture rework and UI improvements (Work in Progress)
Significantly refactored the app architecture by introducing Repos and ViewModels. Added edge-to-edge compatibility to more screens.
**Note:** This is a work-in-progress commit. Further development and refinements are expected in subsequent commits.

refactor: Major app overhaul, new features, and dependency updates
Significantly improved the app's stability, performance, and user experience:
- Added a new About Libraries screen with detailed information about the used open-source libraries. - Implemented the EULA (End-User License Agreement) for enhanced user transparency. - Added support for edge-to-edge displays for a more immersive user experience. - Updated all dependencies to the latest versions for enhanced performance and security. - Removed unused dependencies to streamline the project. - Added a `libs.versions.toml` file to manage and track library versions efficiently.

refactor: Improved version info, added explicit encoding, and updated locales
Enhanced app quality and user experience:
- Improved the design and information displayed in the version info dialog. - Added explicit encoding to specific XML files for better compatibility and readability. - Updated the locales config to include pt-BR (Brazilian Portuguese), th (Thai), and zh-Hant (Traditional Chinese). - Removed unused resources to streamline the project and improve build times.

refactor: Improved code structure, removed redundant code, and added About Libraries screen to Settings
Significantly enhanced code maintainability and efficiency:
- Added the About Libraries screen to the Settings menu for easier user access. - Reworked the lesson screen logic to utilize a single, shared repository, improving code reusability and reducing redundancy. - Removed numerous redundant and repeated classes to streamline the codebase.

refactor: Improved Android SDKs table performance and updated lessons
Significantly enhanced performance and user experience:
- Reworked the Android SDKs table for improved performance and responsiveness. - Added the latest Android versions to the table. - Updated more lessons to the new, streamlined structure for better code maintainability and reusability.

refactor: Updated dependencies and configurations
Significantly enhanced app stability and performance:
- Updated Android Gradle Plugin to version 8.10.1. - Updated various dependencies to their latest versions, including Firebase BOM, ConstraintLayout, GridLayout, Kotlinx Serialization, Lifecycle components, Navigation components, Core KTX, and Play Services Ads. - Updated `google-services.json` with new project information. - Modified `AndroidManifest.xml` to update Google Analytics and AdMob configurations. - Updated `AppOpenAd.java` to use the new AppOpenAd load callback. - Updated Gradle wrapper to version 8.14.1. - Incremented app version code to 35 and version name to 5.0.1. - Updated CHANGELOG.md.
feat: Add new languages support and update .gitignore

refactor: Updated URLs for Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and Code of Conduct and updated dependencies
Updated the URLs for the Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and Code of Conduct across various parts of the application and documentation.
The old Google Sites URLs have been replaced with new GitHub Pages URLs to reflect the new location of these documents.
- Updated links in `preferences_settings.xml` - Updated links in `StartupActivity.java` - Updated links in `WebViewActivity.java` and its corresponding raw text file - Updated links in `HelpActivity.java` - Updated links in `README.md`
Additionally, the following dependencies and Gradle wrapper were updated: - `appcompat` to `1.7.1` - `firebaseBom` to `33.15.0` - `lifecycle` (livedata, runtime, viewmodel) to `2.9.1` - `playServicesAds` to `24.4.0` - Gradle wrapper to `8.14.2`

refactor: Update app configurations and target SDK
- Updated the target SDK to 36. - Removed manifest placeholders for analytics and ad storage, as these are now handled directly in `AndroidManifest.xml`. - Added new AdMob and Firebase Performance metadata to `AndroidManifest.xml`. - Ensured Google Analytics screen reporting and storage are enabled by default. - Set ad user data and personalization signals to follow `eu_consent_policy`.

refactor: Update app configurations and target SDK
- Updated the target SDK to 36. - Removed manifest placeholders for analytics and ad storage, as these are now handled directly in `AndroidManifest.xml`. - Added new AdMob and Firebase Performance metadata to `AndroidManifest.xml`. - Ensured Google Analytics screen reporting and storage are enabled by default. - Set ad user data and personalization signals to follow `eu_consent_policy`. - Corrected a constructor call in `HomeViewModel.java`.

refactor: Improved startup activity and minor UI updates
Significantly enhanced app stability and user experience:
- Refactored the startup activity to ensure a smoother app launch. - Updated the "Get on Google Play" button text to "Play Store" for brevity. - Removed the "same_code_switches" string as it was no longer in use.

refactor: Improved settings screen icons and added new icons
Significantly enhanced user experience and visual consistency:
- Replaced existing icons on the settings screen with improved versions for better clarity and visual appeal. - Added new icons for various settings options to enhance discoverability and user interaction. - Changed icon sizes to 24dp for better consistency and alignment with Material Design guidelines. - Removed unnecessary icon tinting from PreferenceCategory to simplify the visual hierarchy and improve readability.

refactor: Improved settings screen icons and added new icons
Significantly enhanced user experience and visual consistency:
- Replaced existing icons on the settings screen with improved versions for better clarity and visual appeal. - Added new icons for various settings options to enhance discoverability and user interaction. - Changed icon sizes to 24dp for better consistency and alignment with Material Design guidelines. - Removed unnecessary icon tinting from PreferenceCategory to simplify the visual hierarchy and improve readability.

refactor: Updated permissions screen and dependencies
Enhanced user experience and app stability:
- Reorganized permissions on the permissions screen into "Normal," "Runtime," and "Special" categories for better clarity. - Added "Wake Lock" permission to the "Normal" category with a detailed summary. - Updated the app version code to 38. - Added `WAKE_LOCK` permission to `AndroidManifest.xml`.

refactor: Added daily tips to arrays.xml
Enhanced user experience:
- Moved the `daily_tips` string array from `strings.xml` to `arrays.xml` for better resource organization.

refactor: Added new languages, fixed Play Store link, and updated version code
Enhanced user experience and app functionality:
- Added support for Arabic, Bengali, Brazilian Portuguese, Filipino, Korean, Spanish (Mexico), Swedish, Thai, Traditional Chinese, Urdu, and Vietnamese languages. - Corrected the Play Store link in `HomeRepository.java` to point to the correct application ID. - Updated the app version code to 39. - Fixed minor typos in French translations. - Removed unnecessary ">" character from the `ad_banner_unit_id` string.

fix: Corrected Android 15 version information
This commit addresses an issue with the displayed Android 15 version information:
- The Android 15 codename was initially shown as "Vanilla Ice Cream," which has been corrected to "VanillaIceCream" (without the space) to align with official naming. - The version code has been incremented to reflect this update.
